roleame-webapp.examples.auth.description: This component is only accessible for authenticated users
Logging out will cause user to be redirected to home screen if visiting route accessible only to authenticated users
roleame-webapp.examples.auth.title: Authenticated component
roleame-webapp.examples.crud.empty: Looks like you don't have any books, let's add some!
roleame-webapp.examples.crud.text: Books can be managed in this editor and are added, updated, deleted and selected through
roleame-webapp.examples.crud.title: CRUD books using @ngrx/entity & @ngrx/router-store
roleame-webapp.examples.form.text3: You have to request a gift to see more information.
roleame-webapp.examples.form.title: Reactive form using a form builder
roleame-webapp.examples.notifications.de: Default notifications for events of low importance
roleame-webapp.examples.notifications.er: Error notifications, when things go really wrong...
roleame-webapp.examples.notifications.in: Info notifications for events of medium importance
roleame-webapp.examples.notifications.su: Success notifications for reporting of a successful end of an operation or action
roleame-webapp.examples.notifications.wa: Warning notifications for events that require user attention
roleame-webapp.examples.stocks.descripti: Please provide some valid stock market symbol like:
roleame-webapp.examples.stocks.text1: Stock market example shows how to implement
roleame-webapp.examples.stocks.text4: Updating symbol query with different symbol will emit action which updates state with loading flag (reducer) and triggers effect for retrieving of selected stock.
roleame-webapp.examples.stocks.text5: Actions are debounced and every subsequent request will cancel previous one using
roleame-webapp.examples.stocks.text6: Success or error actions are emitted on request completion. Loading spinner is removed and stock info or error message is displayed.
roleame-webapp.examples.stocks.title: Stock market
roleame-webapp.examples.simple-state-man: NgRx is a great state management library but sometimes it can be an overkill to use it in simpler applications with limited routing or state sharing needs.

In these cases we usually reach for solution involving RxJs BehaviorSubject which enables to share our state as an Observable stream while also enabling service to imperatively retrieve and mutate Subjects state imperatively...
This pattern was wrapped and made more convenient by
which is a simple state management with minimalistic API, one way data flow, multiple models support and immutable data exposed as RxJS Observable
You can also add it to your project using

roleame-webapp.examples.title: Examples
roleame-webapp.examples.todos.text3: example with support for adding, toggling, removing and filtering of the todo items.
roleame-webapp.examples.todos.text5: module and support for lazy loaded reducers (this is a lazy loaded feature module).
roleame-webapp.examples.todos.text6: Todos are persisted into local storage so you should see your todos also on later visits when using the same browser.
